results.content: I am enjoying the modules. Everything makes sense and works!!

results.content:
Good and thorough course. Spending bit more time on actual FastAPI would be nice. Like explaining in bit more detail about the features. And perhaps bit less time spent on front end things. Although, I did like using the full app as an example.

Also, there are some naming issues and inconsistencies but those are rather minor issues.
results.content_html:

results.content: Very good for study about FastAPI and some technics for dev.
results.content_html: Very good for study about FastAPI and some technics for dev.

results.content: I think that the course was a good introduction to FastAPI. There were several instances where the presentation produced unworkable code. It would have been helpful to have a link to a github with a commit for each module in the course. I think that the foundations for a great course are here but there needs to be some fit and polish issues that need to be done to get the course there.

response.content:
I am working on the content, communication and presentation skills to improve the course.
In the next iteration, I will surely improve

results.content: Great class. I must say though that it is very useful if the user has at least gone through fastapi documentation heading into this course.
results.content_html: Great class. I must say though that it is very useful if the user has at least gone through fastapi documentation heading into this course.

results.content: The course content was interesting and I learned a lot; however, most of the source code not being provided, errors in the content, and inconsistent variable naming or changes in variable names between videos makes this course challenging to follow. I would also love to see the addition of an introduction to pydantic, as the course appears to have assumed prior knowledge of this library. Other libraries in the course were adequately explained. I think the course is ok, but there is definitely room for improvement. Providing access to full source code would make the course easier to follow. Use of git for source control also drops off part of the way through the course, perhaps the instructor thought it was routine for the students by that point, or was it no longer important?
results.content_html: The course content was interesting and I learned a lot; however, most of the source code not being provided, errors in the content, and inconsistent variable naming or changes in variable names between videos makes this course challenging to follow. results.content:
The teacher should improve his microphone or english skills. It's impossible to understand what he is saying because of his strong accent and sometimes is low.
The teacher should provide all of the resources principally the html with bootstrap.
I had to stop to copy what he has and took too much time on it.
The teacher didn't provide a git repository of the current project.

The course needs to be refactored and show more the details of the security process.
